meanings.definition: Third person singular present indicative of have.
meanings.sent3: The cat hath decided to nap in the sun.
meanings.sent4: Time hath a way of changing everything.
meanings.sent5: The wind hath a gentle touch on the leaves.

meanings.definition: Used archaically to indicate possession or ownership.
meanings.sent1: His hath of land was vast.
meanings.sent2: The hath of the king was undeniable.
meanings.sent3: The hath of the treasure chest was a mystery to all.
meanings.sent4: Her hath of knowledge impressed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The hath of the ancient artifact intrigued historians.
